official_title: To require the Secretary of the Interior to prepare a national least-cost energy plan and to prohibit any oil and gas leasing on federal lands currently withdrawn from, or not available for, oil and gas leasing until such a plan is submitted to the Congress.
short_title: National Energy Security Planning Act of 1990

summary.text: National Energy Security Planning Act of 1990 - Prohibits the Secretary of the Interior from issuing any oil or gas leases until after sending the Congress a National Least-Cost Energy and Conservation Plan. Outlines Plan contents, (including energy demand forecasts and resource inventories) and mandates its revision and resubmissions to the Congress at least every five years.

titles.title: National Energy Security Planning Act of 1990

To require the Secretary of the Interior to prepare a national least-cost energy plan and to prohibit any oil and gas leasing on federal lands currently withdrawn from, or not available for, oil and gas leasing until such a plan is submitted to the Congress.
